REG Linux device image

Khadas VIM 3L

Khadas VIM 3L pairs the Amlogic S905D3 SoC with the REG Linux stack for a polished retro console.

More Khadas devices Official board page
  • Manufacturer: Khadas
  • SoC: Amlogic S905D3
  • Maintained on the REG Linux download channel

Hardware specifications

Built for Khadas

REG Linux targets this hardware profile so you can flash and play without manual tweaking.

Manufacturer

Khadas

SoC

Amlogic S905D3

Image availability

Download the latest build from the REG Linux downloads hub (Khadas section).

Install notes

Flash Khadas VIM 3L and boot

Follow the workflow below; the official board page contains any extra quirks for the Amlogic S905D3 platform.

  1. Grab the image. Download the latest Khadas VIM 3L build from the downloads page or the official board entry.
  2. Flash to storage. Use balenaEtcher, Raspberry Pi Imager, or `dd` to write the image to an SD card or SSD. Make sure to verify the checksum before booting.
  3. First boot setup. Insert the media into your Khadas VIM 3L, power on, and let REG Linux expand the filesystem. Pair controllers inside EmulationStation once prompted.
  4. Troubleshoot with rescue tools. REG Linux ships with an immutable base and rescue partitionâ€”if something breaks, reboot into rescue or reflash without touching your ROMs.

Need a refresher?

Cross-check kernel notes, device trees, or wiring tips on the Khadas VIM 3L board page.
